qas.question: When did the Act of "Nihil novi nisi commune consensu" happen?
Who granted the act Act of "Nihil novi nisi commune consensu"?
What did The Act of "Nihil novi nisi commune consensu" Do

answers.text: forbade the king to pass any new law without the consent of the representatives of the nobility

qas.question: What happened to the notabilities political position?
What has happened to the legislative power?

answers.text: legislative power from the king to the Sejm.

context: On <a0_0>3 May 1505<a0_0/> <a1_0>King Alexander I Jagiellon<a1_0/> granted the Act of "Nihil novi nisi commune consensu" (Latin: "I accept nothing new except by common consent"). This <a2_0>forbade the king to pass any new law without the consent of the representatives of the nobility<a2_0/>, in Sejm and Senat assembled, and thus <a3_0>greatly strengthened<a3_0/> the nobility's political position. Basically, this act transferred <a4_0>legislative power from the king to the Sejm.<a4_0/> This date commonly marks the beginning of the First Rzeczpospolita, the period of a szlachta-run "Commonwealth".
